title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 9 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on 2 Corinthians chapter 9 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 9 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of 2 Corinthians Chapter 9.

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 9:2, which region was ready a year ago in the matter of ministering to the saints?
questions.correctAnswer: Achaia
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 9:2 states that Achaia was ready a year ago, showing their forwardness in ministering to the saints.

questions.question: In 2 Corinthians 9:6, what is said about the one who soweth sparingly?
questions.correctAnswer: He shall reap also sparingly
questions.explanation: The verse teaches that he which soweth sparingly shall also reap sparingly, indicating the principle of giving and receiving.

questions.question: What does 2 Corinthians 9:7 say about how a man should give?
questions.correctAnswer: Not grudgingly or of necessity
questions.explanation: The verse clearly states that every man should give as he purposeth in his heart, not grudgingly or of necessity.

questions.question: True or False: 2 Corinthians 9:4 warns Paul that he might be ashamed if the brethren find the Corinthians unprepared.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 9:4 explains the concern that if those of Macedonia come and find the Corinthians unprepared, Paul and his companions would be ashamed.

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 9:10, what does God minister to the sower?
options: Bread for food and multiplication of seed
questions.correctAnswer: Bread for food and multiplication of seed
questions.explanation: The verse states God ministers both bread for food and multiplies the seed sown, increasing the fruits of righteousness.

questions.question: What is the attitude God loves in a giver according to 2 Corinthians 9:7?
questions.correctAnswer: A cheerful giver
questions.explanation: The verse specifically says God loveth a cheerful giver, emphasizing the importance of the giver's heart attitude.

questions.question: Fill in the blank from 2 Corinthians 9:15: 'Thanks be unto God for his ______ gift.'
questions.correctAnswer: unspeakable
questions.explanation: The verse expresses gratitude for God's 'unspeakable gift,' highlighting its inexpressible value.

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 9:8, what is God able to make abound toward you?
questions.correctAnswer: All grace
questions.explanation: The verse promises that God is able to make all grace abound toward believers to enable them to abound in every good work.

questions.question: True or False: 2 Corinthians 9:1 says it is necessary for Paul to write again about ministering to the saints.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: The verse says it is superfluous (unnecessary) for Paul to write to them about ministering to the saints.

questions.question: What does 2 Corinthians 9:12 say the administration of this service supplies?
options: The want of the saints and many thanksgivings unto God
Only the needs of the poor
Only the needs of the ministers
The needs of the church building
questions.correctAnswer: The want of the saints and many thanksgivings unto God
questions.explanation: The verse explains that this ministry supplies the needs of the saints and results in abundant thanksgivings to God.

questions.question: Who did Paul send to the Corinthians to ensure readiness according to 2 Corinthians 9:3?
questions.correctAnswer: The brethren
questions.explanation: Paul sent the brethren so that the Corinthians would be ready and the boasting of them would not be in vain.

questions.question: What does 2 Corinthians 9:13 say the experiment of this ministration causes people to do?
options: Glorify God for your subjection to the gospel and liberal distribution
questions.correctAnswer: Glorify God for your subjection to the gospel and liberal distribution
questions.explanation: The verse states that through this ministry, others glorify God for the Corinthians’ obedience and generosity.

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Corinthians 9:14, the brethren prayed for the Corinthians because they desired the grace of God in them.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: The verse confirms that the brethren longed and prayed for the exceeding grace of God in the Corinthians.

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 9:11, what results from being enriched in all bountifulness?
questions.correctAnswer: Thanksgiving to God
questions.explanation: The verse explains that being enriched in all things leads to thanksgiving to God through the believers.

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 9:5, what kind of bounty should be ready?
options: A matter of bounty, not of covetousness
questions.correctAnswer: A matter of bounty, not of covetousness
questions.explanation: Paul exhorts that the bounty prepared should be from willing generosity, not from greed or covetousness.

medium.title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 9 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from 2 Corinthians Chapter 9 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does 2 Corinthians 9 teach us about the attitude we should have when giving to others?
options: Give cheerfully and willingly, not grudgingly or of necessity
Give only when forced or pressured
Give to gain praise from others
questions.correctAnswer: Give cheerfully and willingly, not grudgingly or of necessity
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 9:7 clearly states that each person should give as they have decided in their heart, not reluctantly or under compulsion, for God loves a cheerful giver. This principle is supported by the emphasis on readiness and willingness in verses 2, 3, and 5.

questions.question: What principle about generosity can we learn from the metaphor of sowing and reaping in 2 Corinthians 9?
options: Those who sow sparingly will reap sparingly, and those who sow bountifully will reap bountifully
Sowing does not affect what one receives
Only the wealthy should sow bountifully
Reaping is random and unrelated to sowing
questions.correctAnswer: Those who sow sparingly will reap sparingly, and those who sow bountifully will reap bountifully
questions.explanation: Verse 6 uses the agricultural metaphor to teach that generosity leads to greater blessings, reinforcing the biblical principle of stewardship and trust in God's provision. This is supported by verses 8 and 10 which speak of God's grace and multiplication.

questions.question: A believer is worried about not having enough to give. What reassurance does 2 Corinthians 9 provide about God's provision?
options: God will make all grace abound so you have all sufficiency to abound in every good work
You should only give what you can spare after all needs are met
God only blesses those who give large amounts
Giving is optional and without consequence
questions.correctAnswer: God will make all grace abound so you have all sufficiency to abound in every good work
questions.explanation: Verse 8 assures believers that God is able to provide abundantly so they can continue to do good works generously. This promise encourages trust and faith in God's ongoing provision.

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 9, how should a church prepare when planning to give generously to those in need?
options: Prepare beforehand so the gift is ready as a freewill offering, not out of covetousness
Wait until the last minute to gather gifts
questions.correctAnswer: Prepare beforehand so the gift is ready as a freewill offering, not out of covetousness
questions.explanation: Verses 5 and 7 teach the importance of readiness and the right motivation in giving. Preparing beforehand ensures the gift is voluntary and joyful, not forced or out of greed.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the service of giving according to 2 Corinthians 9?
options: To supply the needs of the saints and cause many thanksgivings to God
To gain social status within the church
questions.correctAnswer: To supply the needs of the saints and cause many thanksgivings to God
questions.explanation: Verse 12 explains that giving not only meets the needs of fellow believers but also leads to thanksgiving to God, highlighting the spiritual impact of generosity.

questions.question: How does 2 Corinthians 9 describe the impact of generous giving on others' prayers and longing?
options: Those who receive pray for the givers, longing for God’s exceeding grace upon them
Givers become self-reliant and do not need prayers
questions.correctAnswer: Those who receive pray for the givers, longing for God’s exceeding grace upon them
questions.explanation: Verse 14 highlights that recipients of generosity respond with prayers and longing for God’s grace upon the givers, showing the reciprocal blessings of giving.

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Corinthians 9, Paul needed to write extensively to encourage the Corinthians to serve the saints.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Verse 1 states it was unnecessary for Paul to write extensively about ministering to the saints because he knew their readiness and zeal, showing his confidence in their willingness.

questions.question: What does 2 Corinthians 9 teach about boasting in generosity?
options: Boasting is only meaningful if accompanied by actual readiness and generosity
Boasting is encouraged as a way to motivate others
Boasting should be done publicly to gain honor
questions.correctAnswer: Boasting is only meaningful if accompanied by actual readiness and generosity
questions.explanation: Verses 2-4 show Paul’s concern that boasting about the Corinthians' readiness would be in vain if they were unprepared, emphasizing that true generosity must be practiced, not just spoken of.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'Thanks be unto God for his ________ gift.'
questions.correctAnswer: unspeakable
questions.explanation: Verse 15 concludes the chapter by giving thanks to God for His 'unspeakable gift,' referring to the indescribable grace given through Christ.

questions.question: How does 2 Corinthians 9 emphasize the relationship between righteousness and generosity?
options: Generosity increases the fruits of righteousness
Generosity has no connection to righteousness
Righteousness is only about moral behavior
questions.correctAnswer: Generosity increases the fruits of righteousness
questions.explanation: Verse 10 explains that God multiplies the seed sown and increases the fruits of righteousness, linking generous giving with spiritual growth and righteous living.

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 9, why did Paul send the brethren ahead to the Corinthians?
options: To prepare their bounty beforehand and ensure readiness
To deliver a new gospel message
questions.correctAnswer: To prepare their bounty beforehand and ensure readiness
questions.explanation: Verse 3 and 5 reveal Paul’s intent to send brethren ahead to ensure the Corinthians were prepared and their gift was ready as a matter of bounty, not greed.

questions.question: True or False: 2 Corinthians 9 teaches that God loves a cheerful giver and that giving should be done reluctantly if necessary.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Verse 7 teaches that giving should not be done grudgingly or out of necessity, but cheerfully, because God loves a cheerful giver.

questions.question: How does 2 Corinthians 9 illustrate the effect of generosity on thanksgiving to God?
options: Generosity causes many to give thanks to God
Generosity reduces the need for thanksgiving
Only the giver thanks God, not the receiver
questions.correctAnswer: Generosity causes many to give thanks to God
questions.explanation: Verses 11 and 13 describe how generosity enriches believers and leads others to glorify God, causing abundant thanksgiving.

questions.question: What does 2 Corinthians 9 teach about the motivation behind giving? Select the best biblical principle.
options: Give from the heart with purpose and joy, not from obligation or greed
Give to receive blessings in return
questions.correctAnswer: Give from the heart with purpose and joy, not from obligation or greed
questions.explanation: Verses 5 and 7 emphasize giving as a voluntary, joyful act motivated by the heart, not by greed or compulsion.

questions.question: How does the passage describe the relationship between generosity and God’s grace?
options: God’s grace enables believers to abound in every good work and generosity
God’s grace is unrelated to generosity
questions.correctAnswer: God’s grace enables believers to abound in every good work and generosity
questions.explanation: Verse 8 teaches that God is able to make all grace abound so believers have sufficiency and abound in good works, including generosity.

hard.title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 9 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from 2 Corinthians Chapter 9.

questions.question: What reason does Paul give for not needing to write extensively about ministering to the saints?
options: It is superfluous for me to write to you
questions.correctAnswer: It is superfluous for me to write to you
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 9:1 states that Paul considers it superfluous to write about ministering to the saints because he already knows their readiness.

questions.question: In 2 Corinthians 9:2, to whom does Paul boast about the readiness of Achaia, and what effect did their zeal have?
options: To the Macedonians; it provoked very many
To the Corinthians; it caused jealousy
To the Romans; it encouraged generosity
To the Galatians; it inspired faith
questions.correctAnswer: To the Macedonians; it provoked very many
questions.explanation: Paul boasts to the Macedonians about Achaia's readiness, which provoked many others to act zealously, as stated in 2 Corinthians 9:2.

questions.question: What precaution does Paul take to avoid their boasting being in vain according to 2 Corinthians 9:3-4?
options: He sends brethren ahead to prepare
He waits for Macedonia to arrive
questions.correctAnswer: He sends brethren ahead to prepare
questions.explanation: Paul sends brethren beforehand to ensure the Corinthians are prepared, preventing any shame in boasting, as explained in verses 3 and 4.

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 9:5, Paul exhorts the brethren to go beforehand to make up what kind of gift?
options: A bounty, and not of covetousness
A tithe, and not of obligation
A sacrifice, and not of sorrow
An offering, and not of compulsion
questions.correctAnswer: A bounty, and not of covetousness
questions.explanation: Paul emphasizes that the gift should be a bounty, a voluntary generosity, not driven by greed or covetousness (2 Corinthians 9:5).

questions.question: What principle does Paul teach in 2 Corinthians 9:6 regarding sowing and reaping?
options: He which soweth sparingly shall reap also sparingly; and he which soweth bountifully shall reap also bountifully
He which sows the most will gain the greatest wealth
Reaping is unrelated to sowing in generosity
Only the righteous will be rewarded
questions.correctAnswer: He which soweth sparingly shall reap also sparingly; and he which soweth bountifully shall reap also bountifully
questions.explanation: This verse uses agricultural metaphor to teach that the extent of generosity determines the extent of blessing (2 Corinthians 9:6).

questions.question: In the Greek term for 'cheerful' (2 Corinthians 9:7), what is the significance of the giver's attitude in giving?
options: God loves a cheerful (hilaros) giver, meaning joyful and willing
God values giving out of obligation
questions.correctAnswer: God loves a cheerful (hilaros) giver, meaning joyful and willing
questions.explanation: The Greek word 'hilaros' connotes joyfulness and willingness, highlighting the importance of the giver's heart in 2 Corinthians 9:7.

questions.question: How does Paul describe God's ability to provide for believers in 2 Corinthians 9:8?
options: God is able to make all grace abound toward you
God limits grace to what is necessary
questions.correctAnswer: God is able to make all grace abound toward you
questions.explanation: Paul emphasizes God's abundant grace that supplies all sufficiency for good works, as stated in 2 Corinthians 9:8.

questions.question: Which Old Testament passage is indirectly alluded to in 2 Corinthians 9:9, emphasizing righteousness through generosity?
questions.correctAnswer: Psalm 112:9
questions.explanation: The quotation in 2 Corinthians 9:9, about dispersing to the poor and enduring righteousness, alludes to Psalm 112:9.

questions.question: What metaphor does Paul use in 2 Corinthians 9:10 to illustrate God’s provision and multiplication of generosity?
options: He that ministereth seed to the sower
questions.correctAnswer: He that ministereth seed to the sower
questions.explanation: Paul uses the agricultural metaphor of God providing seed to the sower to illustrate multiplication of blessings (2 Corinthians 9:10).

questions.question: In 2 Corinthians 9:11, what is the result of being enriched in every thing to all bountifulness?
questions.correctAnswer: Thanksgiving to God through us
questions.explanation: Paul teaches that bountiful enrichment leads to thanksgiving to God, highlighting the spiritual fruit of generosity (2 Corinthians 9:11).

questions.question: How does Paul describe the function of the administration of this service in 2 Corinthians 9:12?
options: It both supplies the want of the saints and causes many thanksgivings unto God
It is a burden only for the wealthy
questions.correctAnswer: It both supplies the want of the saints and causes many thanksgivings unto God
questions.explanation: The service not only meets needs but also results in abundant thanksgivings to God (2 Corinthians 9:12).

questions.question: What two reasons do the recipients glorify God according to 2 Corinthians 9:13?
options: For your professed subjection unto the gospel and your liberal distribution to them and all men
For your wisdom and your wealth
For your faith and your prayers
questions.correctAnswer: For your professed subjection unto the gospel and your liberal distribution to them and all men
questions.explanation: Verse 13 highlights glorifying God because of the Corinthians' obedience to the gospel and their generous giving.

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 9:14, what do the recipients' prayers for the Corinthians specifically long for?
options: The exceeding grace of God in you
questions.correctAnswer: The exceeding grace of God in you
questions.explanation: The recipients pray earnestly for the Corinthians to experience God's abundant grace, as noted in verse 14.

questions.question: What is described as an 'unspeakable gift' in 2 Corinthians 9:15?
options: Thanks be unto God for his unspeakable gift
questions.correctAnswer: Thanks be unto God for his unspeakable gift
questions.explanation: Paul concludes by giving thanks for God's indescribable gift, which contextually refers to Christ and salvation (2 Corinthians 9:15).

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Corinthians 9:7, God accepts gifts given grudgingly or of necessity.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 9:7 says God loves a cheerful giver, not one who gives grudgingly or of necessity.

theological.title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 9 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from 2 Corinthians Chapter 9 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 9:6, what principle does Paul teach about sowing and reaping?
options: He which soweth sparingly shall reap also sparingly; and he which soweth bountifully shall reap also bountifully
He which soweth sparingly shall reap abundantly; and he which soweth bountifully shall reap sparingly
questions.correctAnswer: He which soweth sparingly shall reap also sparingly; and he which soweth bountifully shall reap also bountifully
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 9:6 teaches a principle of proportionality in giving and receiving. This principle aligns with Galatians 6:7 where God is not mocked and one reaps what one sows, Proverbs 11:24 on generous giving, Luke 6:38 on giving and receiving measure pressed down, and Hosea 10:12 on sowing righteousness for a harvest.

questions.question: What attitude toward giving does Paul emphasize in 2 Corinthians 9:7?
options: Giving should be done cheerfully and not grudgingly
Giving must be forced and obligatory
Giving should be secret and hidden
Giving is only for the wealthy
questions.correctAnswer: Giving should be done cheerfully and not grudgingly
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 9:7 emphasizes that each person should give as they purpose in their heart, not reluctantly or under compulsion, for God loves a cheerful giver. This is consistent with Acts 20:35 on the blessing of giving, Proverbs 22:9 on a generous eye, Matthew 6:3-4 on secret giving, and Exodus 35:5 on willing offerings.

questions.question: In 2 Corinthians 9:8, what is God able to do for believers?
options: Make all grace abound toward you so you may abound in every good work
Punish those who do not give
questions.correctAnswer: Make all grace abound toward you so you may abound in every good work
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 9:8 declares God's ability to enrich believers with grace so they have sufficiency and abound in good works. This aligns with James 1:17 on every good gift from above, Ephesians 2:8 on grace as God's gift, Philippians 4:19 on God supplying needs, and Titus 2:11-14 on grace teaching to live godly.

questions.question: What Old Testament truth does Paul quote in 2 Corinthians 9:9 to encourage generosity?
options: He hath dispersed abroad; he hath given to the poor: his righteousness remaineth forever
questions.correctAnswer: He hath dispersed abroad; he hath given to the poor: his righteousness remaineth forever
questions.explanation: Paul quotes Psalm 112:9 in 2 Corinthians 9:9 to show that generosity toward the poor is an expression of enduring righteousness. This typifies God's character and aligns with Proverbs 19:17 on lending to the Lord, Isaiah 58:10 on sharing bread, Matthew 25:35-40 on serving Christ through others, and Deuteronomy 15:7-11 on care for the poor.

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 9:10, what role does God play in the process of giving and blessing?
options: God provides seed to the sower, bread for food, multiplies seed, and increases fruit
questions.correctAnswer: God provides seed to the sower, bread for food, multiplies seed, and increases fruit
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 9:10 presents God as the provider and multiplier who supplies the seed for sowing and increases the harvest, symbolizing blessings and fruitfulness. This aligns with Genesis 8:22 on seedtime and harvest, Luke 8:5-8 parable of the sower, John 15:5 on abiding to bear fruit, and Malachi 3:10 on God's provision through obedience.

questions.question: What is the ultimate result of believers being enriched in every way as described in 2 Corinthians 9:11?
options: Thanksgiving to God is caused through believers
questions.correctAnswer: Thanksgiving to God is caused through believers
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 9:11 explains that enrichment in all things leads to bountifulness which causes thanksgiving to God through believers. This is consistent with Psalm 107:8 on giving thanks, Colossians 3:17 on doing all in Jesus' name, 1 Corinthians 1:4 on thanksgiving for grace, and Philippians 4:6 on prayer with thanksgiving.

questions.question: In 2 Corinthians 9:12, what dual purpose does the administration of the service fulfill?
options: Supplies the needs of the saints and results in many thanksgivings to God
Increases wealth for the church leaders and impresses others
Creates competition among believers and causes envy
Secures political power and social status
questions.correctAnswer: Supplies the needs of the saints and results in many thanksgivings to God
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 9:12 highlights that this ministry both meets the needs of the saints and provokes abundant thanksgivings to God. This mirrors Acts 2:44-45 on sharing in the early church, Hebrews 13:16 on doing good and sharing, Romans 12:13 on contributing to needs, and Psalm 100:4 on thanksgiving entering God’s gates.

questions.question: How do those who receive generously glorify God, according to 2 Corinthians 9:13?
options: By their obedience to the gospel and liberal distribution
questions.correctAnswer: By their obedience to the gospel and liberal distribution
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 9:13 teaches that recipients glorify God because of their submission to the gospel and their generous giving. This corresponds with Romans 6:17 on obedience from the heart, 1 Peter 2:12 on good works glorifying God, Matthew 5:16 on letting light shine, and Hebrews 13:16 on sacrifices pleasing to God.

questions.question: What do the prayers of those who receive for the givers express, according to 2 Corinthians 9:14?
options: Longing for the exceeding grace of God in the givers
questions.correctAnswer: Longing for the exceeding grace of God in the givers
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 9:14 describes that those who receive pray fervently for the givers, desiring God’s abundant grace upon them. This matches James 5:16 on effective prayer, Ephesians 1:17 on spirit of wisdom, Philippians 1:3-4 on prayers with joy, and Colossians 1:9 on prayer for knowledge of God’s will.

questions.question: What phrase does Paul use in 2 Corinthians 9:15 to express gratitude to God?
options: Thanks be unto God for his unspeakable gift
Praise be to God for earthly blessings
Glory to God for our achievements
questions.correctAnswer: Thanks be unto God for his unspeakable gift
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 9:15 concludes with thanksgiving for God's indescribable gift, understood as the gift of Jesus Christ and salvation. This is supported by John 3:16 on God's love gift, Romans 6:23 on gift of God is eternal life, Ephesians 2:8 on grace as gift, and James 1:17 on every good gift from above.

questions.question: Why did Paul send the brethren ahead to the Corinthians as explained in 2 Corinthians 9:3-5?
options: To ensure the Corinthians were ready with their bounty and to avoid shame in boasting
To collect money immediately without preparation
To criticize the Corinthians for not giving
To announce his arrival for judgment
questions.correctAnswer: To ensure the Corinthians were ready with their bounty and to avoid shame in boasting
questions.explanation: In 2 Corinthians 9:3-5, Paul explains sending brethren ahead so the Corinthians would be prepared in generosity, preventing shameful disappointment and validating his boasting to others. This reflects principles in Exodus 36:5-7 on offering readiness, Nehemiah 10:32 on preparedness, Luke 14:28 on planning, and Proverbs 21:5 on diligent planning.

questions.question: What does Paul mean by giving 'not as of covetousness' in 2 Corinthians 9:5?
options: Giving should be voluntary and generous, not from a desire to gain or greed
Giving should be done to receive praise
Giving is mandatory regardless of motive
Giving must be secret to avoid envy
questions.correctAnswer: Giving should be voluntary and generous, not from a desire to gain or greed
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 9:5 instructs that giving must be a matter of generosity, not motivated by greed or seeking personal gain. This aligns with Luke 21:1-4 on sacrificial giving, Matthew 6:1 on avoiding hypocritical giving, 1 Timothy 6:10 on love of money as root of evil, and Proverbs 3:9 on honoring God with wealth.

questions.question: How does 2 Corinthians 9:1 describe Paul's need to write about ministering to the saints?
options: It is superfluous for Paul to write about it
It is urgent and necessary to write extensively
He is doubtful about the Corinthians' willingness
He plans to reprimand the Corinthians
questions.correctAnswer: It is superfluous for Paul to write about it
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 9:1 shows Paul considers it unnecessary (superfluous) to write about the Corinthians' readiness to minister to the saints because he already knows their forwardness, consistent with Philippians 4:10 on rejoicing in their care, Romans 15:26 on contributions, 1 Corinthians 16:1-2 on collections, and Acts 11:29 on sharing relief.

questions.question: What does the phrase 'the forwardness of your mind' in 2 Corinthians 9:2 imply about the Corinthians?
options: They were eager and ready to give generously
They were confused about the purpose
questions.correctAnswer: They were eager and ready to give generously
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 9:2 refers to the Corinthians’ eagerness and readiness to give, inspiring many others. This is consistent with 2 Corinthians 8:7 on excel in grace, Romans 12:11 on fervent in spirit, Colossians 3:23 on working heartily, and Exodus 35:21 on willing hearts.

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 9:4, what concern does Paul express about the Macedonian brethren's arrival?
options: That the Corinthians might be found unprepared, causing shame
That the Macedonians might not come at all
That the Corinthians would give too much
That the Macedonians would take all the gifts
questions.correctAnswer: That the Corinthians might be found unprepared, causing shame
questions.explanation: Paul in 2 Corinthians 9:4 fears that if the Macedonians come and find the Corinthians unprepared, their boasting would be shameful. This concern for readiness echoes Nehemiah 2:11-18 on inspection, Luke 14:28 on counting cost, Proverbs 27:12 on seeing danger, and 1 Corinthians 3:13 on testing works.
